Column Comment.0: UNIQUE WELL IDENTIFIER: A unique name, code or number designated as theprimary key for this row.
Column Comment.1: WELL LOG IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier for the well log.
Column Comment.2: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.3: ACQUIRED FOR BUSINESS ASSOCIATE ID: Unique identifier for the businessassociate who ordered the acquisition of the well log. Usually the operator of the well.
Column Comment.4: ACTIVE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating whether this row of data is currently eitheractive / valid (Y) or inactive / invalid (N).
Column Comment.5: BASE DEPTH: the base depth of the log. Can often be calculated by determining thedepth of the last index on the cuves associated with the log.
Column Comment.7: BYPASS INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this well log was acquired during abypass operation.
Column Comment.8: CASED HOLE INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this log was acquired in acased hole environment.
Column Comment.9: COMPOSITE INDICATOR: a Y/N flag indicating that this curve is a composite ofcurves taken during multiple passes or combined through other types of processing.
Column Comment.10: LOG DEPTH TYPE: the type of depth measurements provided in the log, such asMeasured (MD) or True Vertical (TVD)
Column Comment.11: WELL LOG DICTIONARY: The dictionary contains a set of curve names, propertynames and parameters that are used by a well logging contracter during a specifiedperiod of time. At any given time, a contractor may have one or more dictionaries inuse.
Column Comment.12: EFFECTIVE DATE: date on which the data in this row came into effect.
Column Comment.13: EXPIRY DATE: Date on which the data in this row of data was no longer in effect.
Column Comment.14: JOB IDENTIFIER: Unique identifier assigned to the wireline log job.
Column Comment.15: SOURCE: The individual, company, state, or government agency designated as thesource of information for this row.
Column Comment.16: LOG REFERENCE NUMBER: A reference number assigned to this log, such as a filenumber. These numbers may be used to assist in identifying logs.
Column Comment.17: WELL LOG TITLE: a textual name assigned to a log by a vendor or other company.This information is not validated. Validated classification information (such asINDUCTION, DENSITY etc) should be stored in WELL_LOG_CLASS.
Column Comment.18: PASS NUMBER: Number identifying each recorded pass of the logging tool string asit passes a section of the borehole.
Column Comment.19: MEASURED WHILE DRILLING INDICATOR: A Y/N flag indicating that this log wasacquired during active drilling operations. Acquired while the bit was in the hole.Could be logged while drilling (LWD) or measured while drilling (MWD).
Column Comment.20: ROW_MANAGEMENT_GUID: This value may be used to provide a global uniqueidentifier for this row of data. Use of this column is not mandatory, but if used,optional PPDM NOT NULL and UNIQUE INDEX constraints provided in the datamodel DDL should be created.
Column Comment.21: REMARK: Narrative remarks about this row of data.
Column Comment.22: TOP DEPTH: the top depth of the log. Can often be calculated by determining thedepth of the first index on the cuves associated with the log.
Column Comment.24: TRIP OBSERVATION NUMBER: a unique number assigned to the data related to awell log trip. If unique run numbers exist, they may be used if desired. If not, asurrogate component is created.
Column Comment.25: ROW CHANGED BY: Application login id of the user who last changed the row.
Column Comment.26: ROW CHANGED DATE: System date of the last time the row was changed.
Column Comment.27: ROW CREATED BY: System user who created this row of data.
Column Comment.28: ROW CREATED DATE: Date that the row was created on.
Column Comment.29: ROW_EFFECTIVE_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of datais effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row of data wasmade available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.30: ROW_EXPIRY_DATE: A system assigned date that specified when a row of data isno longer effective from a systems perspective. This may be the date that a row ofdata was no longer available to end users, for example.
Column Comment.31: PPDM ROW QUALITY: A set of values indicating the quality of data in this row,usually with reference to the method or procedures used to load the data, althoughother types of quality reference are permitted.
